metadata.Title: CVE-2020-26147 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel 5.8.9. The WEP, WPA, WPA2, and WPA3 implementations reassemble fragments even though some of them were sent in plaintext. This vulnerability can be abused to inject packets and/or exfiltrate selected fragments when another device sends fragmented frames and the WEP, CCMP, or GCMP data-confidentiality protocol is used. Mathy Vanhoef discovered that the Linux kernelâ€™s WiFi implementation could reassemble mixed encrypted and plaintext fragments. A physically proximate attacker could possibly use this issue to inject packets or exfiltrate selected fragments.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
